titles.title: Marine Mammal Capture Reform Act of 1995
To amend the Marine Mammal Protection Act of 1972 to provide for State disapproval of issuance of permits for the taking of marine mammals in protected State waters.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Fisheries, Wildlife and Oceans.

bill.summary: 1/4/1995--Introduced. Marine Mammal Capture Reform Act of 1995 - Amends the Marine Mammal Protection Act of 1972 to prohibit issuance of a permit for the taking of any marine mammal in the waters of a State for public display if: (1) issuance of the permit would be inconsistent with State law; and (2) the Governor of such State notifies the Secretary of the department in which the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration is operating and the Secretary of the Interior that the State disapproves of the issuance of such permit.
